[81]Dude, one salad ain't going make up for thirty years of chili dogs. 
[82]Fun. Be sure and stab your brother in the eye with a fork for me. 
[83]Fuck you are! Put that thing away. You do not call her. Don't you get it? Talon is back in town. 
[84]So, you're telling me you were sitting there, a sweating, quivering stutter-bucket and when you came back from the can, Molly's hugging a guy who's so good looking you'd probably fuck him. What do you think she's doing this weekend? 
[85]What can you do? She hasn't called - she's not going to. 
[86]Just count yourself lucky. You got to kiss a goddess and you got out before she recalibrated your hardware. A chick like that can raise the bar too high and then once she dumps you, nobody else measures up. 
[87]Don't do it! 
[88]Let it go! 
[89]Would you look at yourself? 
[90]Well, I guess you just solved that. An hour with your family and she'll file for a restraining order. 
[91]Whoa! I don't think so Spanky!   A little lower! 
[92]Well, I guess this is it. I'm surprised she even bothered. 
[93]This wasn't my idea. I ain't dropping twenty bucks to go in there. God-damned planes are in the sky. I can see 'em just fine from the parking lot for free. 
[94]Whoa dude, check it out.   The Blue Angels! 
[95]Those are the coolest guys in the entire world. Think about it - George Clooney or Derek Jeter would trade places with those guys in a second. Can you imagine the sheer magnitude of puss those fuckers tag? I'm gonna get 'em to sign my Hornet! 
[96]Who? The Blue Angel guy?    (cracking up) Duuuuude! 
[97]Seriously, what's with the banner? She's blind, right? Seems like they could have saved a few bucks there. 
[98]Is that really necessary? 
[99]What?   It's closed captioned. 
[100]Dude? 
[101]Sure, I get it. She needs a good guy like Kirky 'cause the guys she dates can't handle it, right? 
[102]Hey, if that chick has a dick, I'll suck it! 
[103]Kirky! Hold up, man! What are you doing!? You can't let her screw up your life! 
[104]Whoa! Don't take it out on me! We both knew this Molly thing wasn't going to work out! It ain't my fault! 
[105]What the fuck you talkin' about? 
[106]Are you worthy of a chick like that? 
[107]That is total bullshit! 
[108]Kirk, she was going to hurt you. 
[109]The longer this went on the worse it would have been. I guarantee it! 
[110]Yes, I do, Kirk! I know exactly what I'm talking about. 
[111]Remember last year when you hardly saw me for about two months? I met my own perfect ten. Tina Jordan. Smart, cool and hot like you wouldn't believe. Hotter than Molly even. 
[112]I didn't tell anyone. I didn't want to jinx it. She was perfect. I was spilling over with...with fucking happy! You know? 
[113]Two months into it, she dumps me. And I knew it was coming. A girl like that. Sooner or later she was bound to get a better offer. But it kicked my ass, man. I was depressed for months. 
[114]I didn't want everyone knowing what a pussy I was. Dude, it was a hurt I can't even put into words. 
[115]I couldn't watch you go through that 'cause I love you, man. You're the brother I never had. 
[116]Yeah, but he's a cheese-dick. 
[117]What!? 
[118]Listen, bitch... 
[119]Ahhh!!   Jesus Christ!!! Kirk!! 
[120]You are! 
[121]What happened? 
[122]Dude!   Stop apologizing! 
[123]Seriously? 
[124]No! No! I get it! It's not a whore thing! Now it works out in his own mind. Right!? He can relax and stop acting like a freak because now he's bringing something to the table! Right, Kirky!? 
[125]Kirky! How you been, brother!? What are you doing here? 
[126]So you're "Branson Bound." 
[127]Relax, your flight doesn't leave for another forty five minutes. 
[128]Why is he so nice all of a sudden? 
[129]Shit, that's right.  So you're back with Marnie then, huh? 
[130]How come I'm not a pirate!? (then to Kirk) Dude, do not tell me that he's going with you guys. 
[131]Look at me Big Slick. 
[132]Look at me. 
[133]Tell me things are good. 
[134]Alright, man. It was good to see you, Kirk. 
[135]Tina, I need to know right now why it didn't work out with us. 
[136]This is important. I was good to you. I was sensitive, right? 
[137]The fuck you just call me!? 
[138]Well, you did dump me, so... 
[139]It was my stupid job, wasn't it? You were embarrassed. 
[140]Okay, I can do that. 
[141]It's okay folks! TSA! This guy's drunk as fuck and he shit himself. We gotta get him off the plane. 
[142]You were right! I messed you up. We gotta fix this thing! Let's go. 
[143]Kirky! In junior high I peed my pants in class and Eric started calling me Stainer, remember? 
[144]Pretty soon everyone else started calling me Stainer because they knew it would make me cry. Then you told me to own that name, to call myself Stainer so nobody could hurt me with it anymore. 
[145]My point is... um... Oh, shit. I was just in the crapper and I had this thing all worked out. Damn it. 
[146]I'm going to have to ask you to fuck off immediately before I feed you your own fuckin' teeth! 
[147]Ooohh! That was my point! You saved me! That time and a bunch of other times too. 
[148]You gotta let me save you this time. It's my turn! Your grandma didn't leave you three million bucks so you could take these a- holes to Branson. 
[149]These people hardly know you. 
[150]Kirk, Marnie's a fuckin' bitch. All due respect. 
[151]Kirk! You said Marnie makes you feel secure but security is bullshit! Look at our jobs! It's all for show! For all we know, there's a bomb on this plane right now! 
[152]You want to see what I think of security!? 
[153]Kirk! When I added all this up for you I made one big mistake. You are a ten. YOU'RE A TEN, MAN! 
[154]You're not buying any of this bullshit are you? 
[155]Right on!    The keys are in my jacket! 
[156]Kirky wait! 
[157]Listen, Kirk. (dramatic pause and music) It's three on the tree and the clutch sticks.
dialogues.MOLLY:
[1]Hi, I'm booked on flight 94 to Burbank. Molly McCall. 
[2]Oh, hello again. 
[3]Uggh. Yeah. It's just a short hop to L.A. but they've got me going back and forth three days in a row. This client is killing me. 
[4]It's a date. 
[5]Oh, sure. 
[6]Oh Geeze. Please tell me I didn't get you in trouble back there. 
[7]Oh my God. I'm so sorry. I know... I lost my grandmother a few months ago and I... 
[8]Your grandmother too? And you were close? Oh, you poor thing. 
[9]My Grammy Keenan was ninety four but independent right to the end. She was always trying to cook for everyone. You couldn't stop her. 
[10]No. I wouldn't know where to begin. 
[11]Oh, geeze, that's me. I'm so sorry. 
[12]I'm Molly. 
[13]Hello? 
[14]Who's calling please? 
[15]Oh, no. I'm already on the plane and we're pushing back right now. 
[16]Oh geeze, some of those are my only prints. It would be such a huge favor if you could hold on to them for me. I'm coming back next week. 
[17]I have your number in my phone. As soon as I get back I'll call you and arrange to pick them up, okay? Thank you so much, Kirk. 
[18]Thanks.   I'm really sorry. 
[19]Hey!     There you are! 
[20]I'm sorry I'm so overdressed. I just came from a work thing. Are you doing okay with...everything? 
[21]Stainer? 
[22]Thank you so much for taking care of them for me! I need to get some copies made. If I lost these...uugh. 
[23]Hey, have you eaten yet? 
[24]I was going to go grab a bite. Let me buy you dinner to pay you back. 
[25]I know. I want to. Come on! The place across the street has the best greasy burgers in town. 
[26]I'll have a Bass. 
[27]Well, it wasn't the original plan. I went to law school. Ended up at a big firm but I hated it. Then, they asked me to plan the Christmas party. It was a big hit and a few months later I was done with law. 
[28]I know.    Pernicious career move, right? 
[29]I'm sorry.     Like, destructive or... 
[30]Pernicious. 
[31]I really do. We do a lot of charity events and I get to work with some of the most amazing human beings on some really fun projects. Next month I'm doing a cancer benefit with Billy Joel. 
[32]The only downside is I have to do a lot of public speaking and I've always struggled with stage fright. 
[33]Are you seriously hitting on me right in front of my boyfriend? 
[34]Did you get a load of that hair- piece? What is it with men? I mean, look at you. You're bald and you're fine with it. A little dignity is all I'm saying. The toupees and plugs and the teen- dream sports cars... Oh geeze, I'm sorry. Do you drive a sports car? 
[35]Oh, my God! I love that book! 
[36]Well, I've got an early morning. I should go. Thanks for coming along. This was really fun. And thanks again for helping me out. 
[37]Oh, stop it. Listen, I handle some of the charity events for the Coyotes and I've got some tickets for the hockey game tomorrow night. You interested? 
[38]Perfect. I hate to see them go to waste. There's two so maybe bring Stainer? 
[39]Hey guys! You made it! Hooray! Thanks for coming. 
[40]Guys, this is my best friend in the whole world, Patty. This is Kirk and, um, Stainer, right? 
[41]Patty's my assistant and my go-to gal. Whatever you need, she can make it happen on a moments notice. 
[42]Oh, and she likes to shock people so don't let her freak you out. 
[43]That was a bogus call, Bobby.    Your skates barely left the ice. 
[44]Oh, I know. It's fine. 
[45]You know my policy on players, Bobby. And you might have noticed we've already got dates. 
[46]Reese, you'd better... 
[47]Patty! Stop it! I'll go see what I can do about Stainer. 
[48]No, it's okay. I know the head of security. I'll be right back. 
[49]But, you can't legally be held responsible for her debt. What kind of hack is this attorney? 
[50]You're a good man, Kirk. 
[51]Listen, no more drinks.    Please. 
[52]I'm sorry.     This happens sometimes. 
[53]Oh, my gosh! Talon! I didn't realize you were in town already. 
[54]Kirk, this is Talon.    This is my good friend, Kirk. 
[55]Wouldn't miss it. 
[56]Please. You're the one the kids go crazy for. 
[57]Only once a year. Talon is our charity liaison at the air show. 
[58]And my ex-boyfriend. 
[59]He had to go but he asked me tell you how much he enjoyed meeting you. 
[60]He is. He's wonderful. I know, I know - the blue eyes and the rock hard abs, right? But he's really so much more than that. A gallery in New York just opened an exhibit of his photography. He's a genius. 
[61]Oh my gosh! This is your apartment? I used to live in this neighborhood back in college. 
[62]We used to come to parties over here sometimes. Oooohh. Can I come up and see your place? 
[63]No, I like it! 
[64]Wow, we have a lot of the same DVDs. Life of Brian, Cool Hand Luke, Family Guy... Beaches, Kirk? 
[65]I love that movie. 
[66]Wow, records. No Way! Look at all this Cheap Trick! 
[67]Are you kidding? Heaven Tonight is the first album I ever owned! A hand-me-down from my big sister. She was the coolest person in the whole world. 
[68]You play the piano? 
[69]Oh, I'll bet you're great.   Play something for me. 
[70]What, the stage fright thing?    Come on it's just me. Please? 
[71]So you've never played in front of anyone? 
[72]Let me guess. You looked at the audience. 
[73]Right there on the stage? 
[74]Shut up! You're lying!      Why would you do that? 
[75]Yeah, that has to be a real bitch. Oh, I shouldn't be laughing. You poor thing. 
[76]Yeah.   That sounds good. 
[77]No thanks. 
[78]Can I give you a hand? 
[79]Listen Kirk, I want you to know that I would really like to, you know, to be with you tonight. 
[80]Well, sure. But... I just don't think I'm ready yet. 
[81]Sure. 
[82]I mean, don't get me wrong. I want to! Believe me - getting naked and crazy sounds fantastic right now. 
[83]Are you okay? 
[84]I just think we should get to know each other first.   I'm no prude. I mean, I'm pretty generous in bed. Once I trust a person, I like to experiment and get pretty wild. 
[85]But, I just need to feel safe first. 
[86]You're the best. 
[87]Okay, well, I'd better go then. 
[88]I had a really nice time.    I'll call you tomorrow. 
[89]I had good directions! 
[90]You don't have a key? 
[91]That sounds great. 
[92]What are you talking about?   I want to meet your family. 
[93]I'm so sorry. It's Patty. I've got to take this. Go ahead. I'll be right in. 
[94]I'm an event planner. 
[95]Well, thank you Eric. 
[96]Actually, Eric's right.   Just a few balloons. 
[97]Hmmm. Honestly, I don't really do a lot of weddings. I specialize more in fund-raisers, corporate events, that kind of thing. 
[98]Right now I'm working on the annual benefit for the Children's Cancer Center.  
[99]I've done a few.  
[100]Geeze, there are so many factors that affect the cost of a wedding.  
[101]Oh, how fun!  
[102]Okay. Before expenses, my base fee for a non-charity event is fifteen thousand. So, I'd ballpark that somewhere around twenty-five grand. 
[103]No, it's fine. The truth is, Kirk and I are just getting to know one another but so far, I think he's decent, he's funny and... You know, when we first met, Kirk asked me in all sincerity if I knew how to do an oil change. 
[104]I know! And, you're right, I don't but... I just love that he asked. 
[105]No, It's fine. 
[106]Kirk. 
[107]Your family I can deal with. 
[108]Do you really think I'm that shallow? You think I need to slum? 
[109]Is that all I am to you? 
[110]Kirk, this can't work if you put me up on some kind of pedestal. 
[111]You already got to first base. Just keep your eye on the ball. 
[112]Let me tie up a couple things and I'll show you around the grounds. 
[113]Katie, I'd like you to meet Kirk. 
[114]What's your wish, Katie? 
[115]Oh, it's a DVD. 
[116]Kirk, I'm so sorry about the piano thing. It was stupid of me. 
[117]Well, anyway, thanks for all your help with Katie's party. I know it meant a lot to her. 
[118]Tonight? 
[119]Kirk, before we do this, there's something I'm really insecure about and you're going to see it sooner or later so... 
[120]Don't rush me... Okay, look. 
[121]If you can't handle it... 
[122]What the hell is wrong with you!? 
[123]No. 
[124]Kirk, I've given you plenty of good reasons. 
[125]A three what?   What are you talking about!? 
[126]What am I up to!?    Good God! 
[127]The only thing I'm going to tell you is that I'd like you to leave. 
[128]No, I need the staff ready to help with bids when the auction begins. - over. 
[129]What is it? 
[130]Okay. Well, what do you want from me? Kids make ashtrays. 
[131]They're not bidding on the artwork; they're bidding on the kids. It's fine. 
[132]What are you doing here!? 
[133]I'm sorry. I have to get in there. Can we talk about this afterwards? 
[134]Thank you. Thanks, Bob. I'm so sorry for my tardiness. The next item up for bids is from nine-year- old Walter Benegan. And this is a... little something that you can put your paper clips or do-dads in... Oh, who am I kidding, it's an ashtray.  Let's start the bidding at one hundred dollars. 
[135]One hundred. Thank you sir. 
[136]Two hundred to the... 
[137]Fantastic. Two-seventy-five.     Do I hear three hundred? 
[138]Two Seventy Five going once.     Going twice. 
[139]Kirk? I hope you don't really think this is going to... 
[140]What!? 
[141]Both of you! This is ridiculous... 
[142]Is that a serious bid? 
[143]Talon!   Please! 
[144]Kirk, that's your entire inheritance. 
[145]Folks, calm down. I don't want to get anyone's hopes up. It's only fair that I clarify something to the bidder. Kirk, please understand that if you commit this money, we will all be eternally grateful and I think your grandmother will be very proud of you... But it doesn't change anything between you and me. 
[146]So, again, is this a serious bid? 
[147]Three million going once. Going twice. Sold to the man in the Branson Bound sweatshirt. 
[148]You realize that there's a good chance this won't work out. 
[149]And you could get hurt. 
[150]And you're going to have to be naked in front of me at some point. 
[151]Three million dollars for kids with cancer and you sing to me? I'm not made of wood you know. 
[152]But one condition. 
[153]You have to go brush your teeth right now.
dialogues.ERIC:
[1]Little brother.   Grammy wants to see you. 
[2]Listen, I'm pretty sure she wants to discuss the will. She won't tell us dick, so we're kind of hoping you can grease the wheels. 
[3]Yeah, yeah, the cremation and what not... 
[4]Debbie, let me handle this. We've got a wedding to pay for, numbnuts, and you know Mom and Dad are going to Branson next month. Now you always been Grammy's favorite so we're counting on you to get in there and sort out what's what. 
[5]It's about time, numbnuts. 
[6]So Kirk gets it all!?   That is bullshit! 
[7]Well!? 
[8]She left him eighty grand!? 
[9]So Kirk owes money!? HA! Shit, man! That is God damn hilarious! 
[10]Close the door, fucknut. 
[11]Nah. Fuckin' Leroy fired me again. Like that dick never came to work with a little buzz on. 
[12]I promise I won't mention her goiter. 
[13]You want another one Dad? 
[14]Nah, fuck him. Anyways, Leroy ain't payin' shit ever since he trucked in all those spics from Fresno. 
[15]Hey, I'm sorry. I didn't know. So, Molly. What do you do? 
[16]You see? That's using your head. That's a business to get into. 
[17]Book a band, blow up a few balloons and people pay out the ass for it. 
[18]So, Molly, me and Debbie here are getting hitched. What do you get for a wedding job? 
[19]But you've done weddings.  
[20]So, what do you get for one?  
[21]We're looking at about two hundred people and we're gonna do this whole Nascar theme.  
[22]So what's the damage for supervising something like that?  
[23]I'm just talkin' ballpark. I'm ain't gonna try and Jew her down.     
[24]Fuck a duck. 
[25]So you're making a comfortable living, you seem like you got your head together more or less and Christ, look at ya. What the hell you doing with numbnuts here? 
[26]Come on, Ma - we're all thinking it. 
[27]Funny? Kirk is funny?    Tell us a joke there Sinbad. 
[28]No shit, when you dump him, he's liable to kill himself. 
[29]You think you're hot shit now?    Is that it? 
[30]You think you're better than me. Say it. Well take a look around, Big Slick.  Every one of these says Eric. First place! First Place! M.V.P.! 
[31]Winner! Winner! You think you're the winner now? Well forget it, man! I don't buy this for a second. 
[32]You show up here with that piece of ass!? Either you're fucking with us or she's fucking with you so which is it? 
[33]A little!? Are you shitting me? Alright, alright! I think we can all agree that Debbie here is one wicked hot box. 
[34]Yeah, and this Molly makes her look like a pig. 
[35]You see? This girl of yours is already startin' shit. (Calling after Debbie) Come on baby! Kirk didn't mean nothing by that! 
[36]I'm goin' upstairs and gettin' to the bottom of this. 
[37]I think this gal is messing with my little brother and I'm not going to sit still for it. 
[38]Way to go numbnuts. You should have let me handle it. 
[39]Hey Stainer! Long time no see! Take care, bro! 
[40]Tom fuckin' Wopat, bro! 
[41]Go get him Kirk! It's chump change to you now. 
[42]You stupid son of a bitch! 
[43]You are such a numbnut. I am telling you - absolute numbnuttery! 
[44]Sure. Careful with it there, Captain Jack. It cost him three million bucks. 
[45]Whoa! All due respect there, Big Shot. How would you know? You had all that shit when you bagged the big ones. 
[46]You believe this fuckin' guy? 
[47]Fine.   Geeze. What's up your ass?
dialogues.PATTY:
[1]Hey boys.     Nice to meet you. 
[2]You need a cock-shaped cake with a cotton-candy bush delivered by four o'clock? I'm your connection. 
[3]Kirk, Molly's sister is blind. 
[4]You'd better check that tone, Reba! You do NOT want me comin' up there! 
[5]That's okay, if Reese did that to me I'd have gone over the glass too. But I would have landed a few before they got me. Reese has been all over Molly ever since she dumped her boyfriend. I tell you, that girl has nothing but trouble when it comes to men. 
[6]Tell me about it. I'm no lezbo but sometimes she makes me want to strap on - if know what I'm saying.  
[7]It's a curse, looking like that. Who has the balls to hit on her? Just the most arrogant A-holes like Reese out there.  
[8]Listen, Molly brought me along tonight because, you know, she thought I might be 'interested.'  
[9]But, just for honesty's sake, I'm not interested. No offense.  
[10]What? You? No, I'm talking about your pal, Stainer. I know he's your friend but he seems like kind of a dumbshit.  Wait. Why would you think I was talking about you?  
[11]Oh my God. You don't have a clue do you? Molly's really into you.     
[12]A knockout like Molly be interested in a spud like you? 
[13]Got me. Again, no offense. But listen, Kirk, your dream girl just showed up. Try not to blow it. 
[14]Here they come! Everybody hide! 
[15]Listen, Molly would kill me if she knew I was telling you this but I'm trying to do you a favor. 
[16]Molly has this physical...um issue. You know, kind of like a birth defect? 
[17]It's not a big deal but she's really self-conscious about it. Talon and some other guys she's dated have been weirded out and made her feel like a freak. 
[18]It's better if she tells you but if you can't deal with it, just get lost now and don't put her through that heartbreak again. 
[19]Good. 'Cause if you do, it'll be your last conscious act... (she stands) Cake? 
[20]You got some big red apples showing your face around here again. 
[21]No.     Get lost. 
[22]Oh, for Christ sake! This one too!? 
[23]I'm warning you both - Molly has been through enough. You go near her and I will fuck you all the way up! Understand!? 
[24]Who's your Mommy!?   Come on!   Who's your Mommy!? 
[25]That's right! Patty is, isn't she! 
[26]You shut your hole!  What happened? 
[27]Every time you say you're sorry, dumbshit here gets his bell rung. 
[28]It's too late for this shit, Kirk. 
[29]I thought she was a blackjack dealer. 
[30]Wow. So, what does this have to do with Molly? 
[31]So, what, now you can afford her!? 
[32]You know what, Kirk - I told Molly you were different but you're just as shallow and full of shit as the rest of them, aren't you? 
[33]Leslie! We're not here to feed these people, we're here to cure fucking cancer! 
[34]Now I want every one of those motherfuckers back there taking bids in fifteen - out! 
[35]Lady, he just gave three million dollars. He can go up there and try to blow himself for all I care.
dialogues.MARNIE:
[1]Kirk, you've been really great about your mom and I staying so close since we broke up but I know how much Grammy meant to you... Well, is it okay with you that I'm here? 
[2]Okay, good. Then can I introduce you to my new boyfriend? 
[3]Ron, this is Kirk. 
[4]I don't know who that is. 
[5]Kirk, I'm sorry about Grammy. 
[6]I realize she was never that crazy about me but I know how much you loved her and I hope you're okay. 
[7]Listen, are you going to Branson with your folks next month? 
[8]What's wrong with Branson?     You too good for Branson now? 
[9]Well, your mom invited Ron and I along. We'd love to go but not if it's going to be weird for you. 
[10]...I mean the tickets are non- refundable but it's up to you. 
[11]Kirk, I'm sorry about what happened with us. You're going to make someone very happy someday, but you have to get over me first, okay? Is it a deal? 
[12]I wouldn't really call it a restaurant, Ron. 
[13]It's a Pizza Hut with no tables. It's a take out place. 
[14]Got to get home and let Peanut out. (she wipes some lint off of Kirk's shirt sleeve.) Kirk, you look really good. 
[15]Ron!   Let's go! 
[16]Good, you got my note. 
[17]I'm sorry to bug you at work but this couldn't wait. 
[18]Kirk, I think I messed up. I see a change in you and I like it. So, I was thinking that we should maybe... get back together. Just to try it out, you know? 
[19]Why not? Please don't say it's because of this Molly person. 
[20]Good. I was really worried about you with her. She seems like kind of a bitch. 
[21]Well, she acts like she's better than everyone with her hybrid car and her la-de-da charity work. 
[22]Okay, maybe so. See? This is what I mean. You never argued with me before. You're really growing. 
[23]If you want to get back together, of course, I'll break up with Ron. 
[24]I'm not going to risk being all alone just because you don't know what's good for you. Come on, Kirk. Deep down, you know where you belong. 
[25]Come on, Kirk. 
[26]Look, I've got seven people in my party so we're going to need to board right away. 
[27]What difference does that make!? 
[28]Fine. We're not in the A group but we're still getting on next. 
[29]Hit him Kirk! Or else I will!
dialogues.TALON:
[1]I just flew in this morning. 
[2]Great to meet you, sir. 
[3]So, do we have you for our Disabled Angels Program again this year? 
[4]That's fantastic.  Mol is always a big hit with the kids. 
[5]And? 
[6]Excellent to see you again, sir. 
[7]Yes sir, a Naval Aviator. 
[8]No, it's my name. 
[9]Oh, I'd rather not say. It's embarrassing. Just something the guys gave me... 
[10]Anyway listen Kirk, is it fair to say that you and Mol are close? 
[11]Well, I understand that fellas like yourself tend to have uniquely candid relationships with the women they befriend. Am I right? 
[12]Don't get me wrong. I have no problem with your lifestyle. What grown men do in the privacy of their homes is none of my concern. 
[13]Hey, I'm in the Navy. I don't ask and I don't expect you to tell. 
[14]Now, I don't know what Molly's told you about me, but anything bad - I deserve. I hurt that girl. I hurt one of God's own angels and I've regretted it every minute since. 
[15]God as my witness, I WILL make it right. I WILL get her back. Can I count on you to put in the good word for me, Poncho? 
[16]You're the man. Come here. 
[17]There you go. Feel the tolerance. 
[18]Roger! 
[19]It's okay Kirk. You'll rock us next time right chief? 
[20]I'm glad you're here. I feel terrible about our little misunderstanding. I don't know what had me thinking you were a gay fella. Molly tells me you two have been seeing each other. 
[21]She's got every right. I'd hate me too.  I want to congratulate you, Poncho. You're the better man. Now, I'll step aside and truly wish you the best of luck. I wouldn't wish losing that girl on my worst foe. But, make no mistake, you blow it and I'll be waiting in wings. Love and war, right chief? 
[22]I came to say I'm sorry and to put in a request for a second chance. 
[23]I'm looking forward to it. 
[24]Eleven thousand! 
[25]Fifteen thousand five hundred! 
[26]Fifty thousand dollars! 
[27]So, Molly... Can we finish our conversation?
dialogues.DEVON:
[1]Hey Kirk.    How you been holdin' up? 
[2]She's coming here?      She a cute gal? 
[3]One door closes, another door opens. 
[4]That's defeatist thinking. 
[5]Holy Frijole. 
[6]Atta boy Jackers! 
[7]Pretty impressive catch, Kirky. 
[8]Kirk, you deserve a gal like her. And Stainer, why don't you try to be a little more supportive. 
[9]Stainer!    Cool your jets, buster. 
[10]Stainer, that's just dirty pool. He's at least a four. 
[11]Kirk said she likes his Taurus. 
[12]A hard ten? 
[13]What about Rick Ocasek?   Billy Joel, Donald Trump... 
[14]What?   What's going on? 
[15]Excuse me? 
[16]Ahhhh No. 
[17]Well, what's wrong with her? 
[18]Well that could be anything. Did she say it was a birth defect? 
[19]Oh, wow. What if this is Patty's way of telling you that Molly is a man?
dialogues.JACK:
[1]She sounded like a hell of a lady. 
[2]What was that all about? 
[3]Entrepreneur? Kirk, I know that guy. He owns a Pizza Hut. 
[4]Absolutely. Visualize it. 
[5]Oh shit.   Yeah, you're right. 
[6]Are we still bowling? 
[7]Oh, not even you, huh? 
[8]Bullshit.    Then what am I? 
[9]Fine, you're a five then. 
[10]Is there an artist exemption for being a jag-off? 
[11]So, if he were a millionaire? 
[12]That's terrible. 
[13]What if it's something really bad? 
[14]That's cool that you love her but it's pretty fucked up to be rooting for a harsh deformity.
dialogues.GRAMMY:
[1]There you are Big Slick.   Did you bring 'em? 
[2]Just hand 'em over. I'm on death's door and you know it. 
[3]Oh, for Christ's sake. Filters? 
[4]Don't start that shit now. You're looking at one lucky old broad who's done a lot - skydiving, rollerderby, colored fellas. I got no complaints. So when the check comes I don't want any blubbering or bullshit outta you. Just enjoy your life like I did mine and raise a glass to your old Grammy once in a while. 
[5]You know how much I love you Kirk. 
[6]Testing. One, two, three, four. Oh, this God damned thing! 
[7]Jap piece of shit! Is it on!? 
[8]Okay, my name is Stella Edith Dakin and if you're watching this, I'm dead as a doorknob and I ain't spent all my money yet. I got shit to do today so I'm going to get right to it. This is my last will and testament and if you miss anything the old Jew's got the paperwork. Okay, here's the deal... 
[9]Hello? I'm kind of busy right now Eric... Oh, for God's sake, boy! How can you be sure it's even yours? It could be practically anybody's!... No, I'm not paying for that!... Well, then I guess you're going to be a daddy. Congratulations, now I gotta go! 
[10]Anyway! I love all of you, despite some of the shit you pulled, but I spent my life a gambler and I always put my money on the best bet. The odds of any of you fish doing anything worthwhile with my stack are slim to none. So old Grammy's going all in on Big Slick. 
[11]I'm proud of you, Kirk. Don't let your old Grammy down. Do something good with it. 
[12]Oh, for Christ sakes!
dialogues.FULLER:
[1]...So, let's keep a steely eye out for this bastard.  Before we dismiss, this is your monthly reminder of why we're here. 
[2]The American people want to travel. (Slide: Family in front of a fake dinosaur) They want to attend baseball contests (Slide: Fat guys spilling beers as they go for a foul ball) and popular music concerts. 
[3]They want to be happy. (Slide: People line dancing) But, Security comes first. (Slide: Army soldier with a massive machine gun guards a play- ground) Without security there can be no happy. You are America's front line in the global war on terror. Let's hit the trenches and let's be careful out there. 
[4]You think that's funny!? You wanna sit in first class or you wanna sit on my gloved and jellied finger!? 
[5]Did'ja see that? Boy would I ever like to...you know...put my penis in her vagina. 
[6]Ma'am, could you please remove your jacket and shoes? 
[7]Why don't we go ahead and strip off that belt too while we're at it. 
[8]Any piercings you'd like me to know about? 
[9]You best hope the terrorists are taking personal calls on the job too, mister! 
[10]You think you're pretty smart don't you Kettner. Thin ice mister! 
[11]Good! Don't come back, Kettner! America is safer without you!
dialogues.WILLY:
[1]Kirk! You look like someone made a second number in your breakfast cereal. You are doing okay, yes? 
[2]He does not know! 
[3]Nope! 
[4]Perfect! Willy is having another kick ass of a day. 
[5]It is Kirk and his crazy friend Stinker and they are most upset! 
[6]He's hurting now! 
[7]He does not know! 
[8]Perhaps he does know after all! 
[9]Yes, how come no word of this Tina!? 
[10]Fucking happy! 
[11]What a pussy.
dialogues.RON:
[1]Uh, oh - the ex. Awkward! (Ron and Mr. Kettner laugh) No! I'm just jack-assin' with you, pirate. Great to meet you. How you doing? 
[2]Right. Of course. I'm sorry about your grandmother. It's just so... Well, old people, you know, what are you gonna do? 
[3]I did like you said Mr. K. 
[4]I got this, Kirk. Eric, before you go bad-mouthin' a whole group of people, you should know that my grandmother on my father's side is from Fresno. 
[5]You know, Molly, I'm a business owner myself. A little restaurant. 
[6]We serve food that people eat.   So - restaurant. 
[7]I'm coming! It was really fantastic to meet you Molly.   If you ever need a pizza... 
[8]Cripes Kirk! Crack a window in there pirate! HAHAHA! 
[9]Hey Stainer. Hey Pirate, can you spot me a twenty. I want to get me one of them travel pillows.
dialogues.WAITER:
[1]Start you off with something to drink ma'am? 
[2]And for your... brother? 
[3]Oh, I'm sorry. I just figured... 
[4]Great.    Sorry. 
[5]Madame. From ze gentleman in ze grey suit. 
[6]From ze gentleman in ze purple tie. 
[7]Of course.     No more drinks, madame. 
[8]Madame, your bill has been covered by ze woman in ze Raiders Jacket.
dialogues.HABIB:
[1]Howdy Kirk. Lemme guess; I been flagged for a random search. 
[2]No, sir. Pediatric convention in Delaware. 
[3]Kirk, I know you're just doing your job but, for Pete's sake, ya'll know me. 
[4]Thanks Kirk. See you next time. 
[5]Praise be to Allah. 
[6]Really!?   Great! 
[7]What!?
dialogues.MAURY:
[1]Oh! You bet! You betcha! Okay, hi there Kirk. Firstly, let me just say how awful sorry I am. Stella was one heck of a gal and a real dish. Anyhow, let me just... 
[2]Oh mercy. I didn't tape over her with The Wheel did I? 
[3]Oh, good.    There she is. 
[4]Let's see here... Looks like she had herself six G's in savings. 
[5]Um, another three grand in bonds, give or take. Her life insurance will pay pert-near seventy grand. 
[6]Most of Stella's retirement home expenses were covered by her reverse mortgage. But, figure in thirty thousand still due to Arborwood Village. She racked up forty-seven thousand in medical bills. And my fee, of course, which now stands at two thousand and change - which is real reasonable, folks. 
[7]Kirk? Geeze, I'm glad I caught you. Listen son, I got something to tell you and don't get mad at me okay? 'Cause this thing ain't my fault. You might want to sit down for this.
dialogues.KATIE:
[1]It's so nice to meet you, I've heard great things. 
[2]May I? 
[3]Robert!    Is Jerry with you? 
[4]These are two of my star pupils, Robert and Jerry. Boys, this is my sister, Molly. 
[5]I wish Kirk would play the piano for me. 
[6]Come on, Kirk! For my birthday? 
[7]Who's this from?
dialogues.BLACK AGENT:
[1]Did you pack your bags yourself? 
[2]Has anyone unknown to you asked you to carry anything onto your flight? 
[3]I think you mean NO. 
[4]She doesn't know what the hell I'm talking about! 
[5]No sweat.     Keep it moving. 
[6]California. Fantastic. So do you travel quite a bit?
dialogues.TINA:
[1]Elmer, I've got customers here. 
[2]That's a large Julius.    Twelve fifty. 
[3]Oh, for Christ's!     Tammy!   Can you cover me!? 
[4]I really liked you Elmer, but all that stuff about me being a ten and how lucky you were and always checking up to see if I was going to dump you... 
[5]What could I do? You were all up in my business all the time. I couldn't breathe. 
[6]I work at Orange Julius, Elmer! If you would have just chilled out and been yourself...
dialogues.BILLY JOEL:
[1]Yeah, I saw that. Tough break in there, my friend. Still, that was a hell of a good thing you did for those kids. 
[2]Beautiful women huh? What are you gonna do? 
[3]It's none of my business but I do know a thing or two about hooking up with women who are out of your league. Can I tell you a little secret? 
[4]Look, it's not about money, fame or power... 
[5]Yeah, but I had all that shit when I lost 'em too. It's not enough. 
[6]Thank you. Look kid, it's not what you can give 'em or even what you can give up. It's what your made of.
